N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 255.459 - External corrosion control: examination of buried pipeline when exposed

State Regulations

Whenever any portion of an existing underground steel
facility is exposed by the operator, a galvanic type anode shall be attached to
that facility if consistent with good corrosion control practices. Whenever an
operator has knowledge that any portion of a buried pipeline is exposed, the
exposed portion must be examined for evidence of external corrosion if the pipe
is bare, or if the coating is deteriorated. If external corrosion is found, the
operator shall investigate circumferentially and longitudinally beyond the
exposed portion (by visual examination, approved indirect method, or both) to
determine whether there is additional corrosion, and remedial action must be
taken to the extent required by the applicable subdivisions of sections
255.483, 255.485, 255.487 and
255.489
